Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Exposure to Communicable Diseases

The information on this page comes from licensing Rule R400.1919 for Family and Group Child Care Homes and R400.8155 for Centers. It discusses what should be done if there is exposure to a communicable disease in a child care site.

Family and Group Home Care

A person who lives in a home or cares for children who has a suspected or confirmed case of a communicable disease shall not come into contact with children in care.

Center Care

If a center becomes aware of contact with disease they must notify parents with:

  • Name of communicable Disease
  • Symptoms of Disease
  • Prevention measures as recommended by the U.S. CDC

The prevention measures have been newly added to the center rule. They are from the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention and can be found here: CDC Disease Conditions

A final valuable source of information that can be found in the support material section of this chapter is ‘Managing Communicable Diseases In Child Care Settings’ .

This was created by a joint effort between the Michigan Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs and the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services.
